website_summaries.verdict: This double-layered corrugated scratcher provides an affordable and satisfying surface for cats to sink their claws into.
pros: Many cats can't resist the natural feel of corrugated scratchers
Eco-friendly construction utilizes recycled paper pulp
Versatile loop design can be hung on a door handle or propped on the floor
Comes with a bag of catnip to attract disinterested kitties
cons: Corrugated scratchers are more prone to shredding than sisal varieties

customer_reviews.title: Purrrrfect!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased a few of these. Our cat absolutely loves this cat scratcher! We chose to keep it on the floor, so we cut the top off of the box that it came in and left the scratcher in it. Between all the scratching and the catnip, she's in kitty heaven. The fact that it's still in the box is a bonus too. What cat doesn't love a box? ;)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: My cat lovessss these! He uses them til he can no longer scratch on them, and then we recycle it and purchase a new one. My cat loves these so much, and they help prevent him from scratching on our furniture. Therefore, we keep multiple around our apartment. However, they do swing around a bit. If you temporarily remove your doorknob and wedge the scratcher between the door and the knob, it can stay in place a lot better. My cat likes this since it helps him scratch on it more easily.
customer_reviews.author: vcgrrl

customer_reviews.title: Just depends
customer_reviews.text: I got this because the cats always scratch on the door when we go outside. One of my cats took to this immediately which was nice however it's not practical for a door that is constantly opened or closed because the scratcher gets caught in the way and is rather annoying. I'll probably just set it on the floor with the other ones i have. It's much narrower but the cats still took to it on the floor so for around $3 this wasn't a bad buy but it's not practical for my door.
customer_reviews.author: B.a.

customer_reviews.title: Better for kittens or small cats
customer_reviews.text: This is all on me...I should have looked at the measurements and figured out how small it is. It's better suited for kittens as you can see. My full grown kitty dwarfs it, so he doesn't really even understand what to do with it. It is well made, seems pretty sturdy. I didn't try hanging it because I wanted to use it as a floor scratcher. I think it might be okay as a hanging scratcher but definitely not a floor scratcher for a big cat. The price is very low though, so I don't feel bad about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dana K. Todd

customer_reviews.title: NOT a "set of 4" - bad labeling, good product
customer_reviews.text: The item title is wrong - this is a single scratcher, not a set of 4. Also does not come w/catnip like the ones you buy in brick & mortor stores. BUT - those issues aside, my kitties LOVE these scratchers!! I don't hang them on the doors - I just set them on the floor, & they use them continuously. When their claws start getting caught on my shirt, I know it's time for a new scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: DragonLight

customer_reviews.title: We have a second bigger cat I bet you’ll get to use it
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for a small cat this item hanging off the door knob is at least 18 inches off the floor to the bottom of the scratching post I thought the item was longer and she’s a little too young for catnip yet also which is infused straight into the cardboard which I didn’t realize So it’s just an item she won’t be able to use and since it was under five dollars it’s not really that big of a deal
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to say aaide from this is a basic corrugated cardboard scratch post. My cats seem to like it ok, but not as much as the big mama one they can comfortably lay on. They dont really seem to know what to do with jt when it hangs on the doorknob so I just keep it in the floor. It did come with some cheap ground up cat nip that resembles dust more than anything. Both cats seemed to enjoy the spot whwre thw cat nip sat and probably leaked through the bag, but had no interest in rhe cat nip itself, which is my fault for only giving them the more potent and expensive kinds.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Fae

customer_reviews.title: elapsed time from hanging to using - 2 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: My cat Lilly is recovering from a long term illness that has required that she spend most, if not all, of her time living in a large dog(ugh) crate. Needless to say, she doesn't get a lot of exercise. I saw this "hanging" scratcher on Amazon, the price is surely a positive, so I got one, glad I did. I attached it to the inside wall of the crate. (There's no room for a scratcher on the floor/bottom of the crate.) Lilly smelled it, rubbed it and within 2 minutes was scratching it like a pro. She's happy and I am too.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H.

customer_reviews.title: CAT LOVES IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think my cat would like this. Looked too cheap and simple. HOLY CRIKEY did she ever LOVE IT!?!?! She went nuts on it. She has been tearing this thing up for months now. Hits it daily. The only downside is that after a while it leaves a pile of shredded cardboard on your floor but if you sweep/vacuum once every week or two you'll barely notice anything. I ended up buying a second one for another room, even though the first one hasn't been used up yet. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Saving my furniture and carpet.
customer_reviews.author: JayPeazy

customer_reviews.title: Product is good
customer_reviews.text: It's a great scratch pad for the price but my cat won't touch it. I have it on the floor not hanging from a door knob, but she won't claw anything other than the carpet. She'll claw the carpet directly next to this scratch pad, but won't touch the actual toy. I coated it with cat nip, I even shoved treats into the corrugations of the cardboard. She's very food motivated, so I thought she might try to claw them out. She just licks it until the cardboard gets soft. She's a jerk. But the product is great. It's the cat that's defective. Someone help me.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: These things are the greatest! My cat actually uses this as a signal to go outside. Before getting these, he would scratch on other things, like a guitar case to tell me he wanted to go out. It rarely comes off the door, which is good because my Pitbull eats it when it does. My cats like the new catnip infused ones. They went for it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Srabee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hang low enough on doorknob
customer_reviews.text: As others have written, this hangs too high on a standard door for my cat to really reach and enjoy it. I’m lying them on the ground and she’s using them. But a lot of my floors are laminate and they slide around. In the future I’ll probably stick to the angled ones with a wider surface that she can really get on top of.
customer_reviews.author: N. Meador

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Kitten
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I needed a basic, small scratcher for my new kitten’s temporary “home base” in the master bathroom. The first time she encountered it, she knew exactly what it was for. She is unusually well-behaved, but it is the only thing she’s scratched or chewed so far. She’s tiny, so she has yet to do any visible damage to it. The listing says this item comes in a pack, however it is actually a single scratcher. Luckily I read reviews clarifying this, so I wasn’t surprised to only receive one. Still, the price is excellent for just one.
customer_reviews.author: KillerQueen12

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES this thing!
customer_reviews.text: My cat kept nervously scratching up my new carpet after we moved - this product was the perfect solution! She now tears the cardboard up instead of tearing my carpet up. Great product, cheap price, and probably saved my floors!
customer_reviews.author: Prime&Proper

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My kitten LOVES this scratcher! Went back and bought 2 more for around the house. The card board does give you the option to hang from a door handle but my kitten is too short for that. So far my kitten has not destroyed the cardboard so I have not seen any flakes around the house. Another plus side is it's a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Instant Winner
customer_reviews.text: My cat who loves cardboard has picked up a new habit of leaning up on the walls to scratch. I bought this and the size ratio from the door knob to the floor works for him. He is able to reach up and give it a go. It doesnt move a lot when he scratches or when I open the closet door. RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Second one purchased
customer_reviews.text: I had a cousin tell me about this product after I told her our cat was scratching on the back of our furniture. She said she had the same problem until she got one of these so I figured I would give it a try. She was right the cat loves to use this to scratch on and most importantly isn't scratching on my furniture anymore. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Only one, not a set
customer_reviews.text: In my rush to order this “set of 4” scratchers with a door hook, I didn’t read the reviews. It’s only one. It is thick but not reversible. My cats haven’t noticed it yet so I can’t comment on that but it would last longer if you could reverse it. The cardboard hook seems like it’s pretty strong though.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: cat not impressed
customer_reviews.text: the low review is basically because my cat didn't use them and wouldn't go near them. the concept and quality of the product seen good and there is a connected piece that would loop over a door handle problem was my cat didn't scratch at the doors so I taped it to where he does scratch and he completely avoided it even with the catnip applied had he used them i would givevit a 5 stars they are cheap enough to try though so wouldn't hurt to try them
customer_reviews.author: R. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Worth getting for a new cat or shelter kitties
customer_reviews.text: Most cats like to scratch - it's natural. Some cats get returned to the shelter (or unpleasantly treated) when they scratch things like furniture. Offer appropriate scratching items, and redirect energies in a positive way for all. Great price, handy size for cages. Good for a starter scratcher with a new kitten or cat to see if they'll use it before doling out bigger bucks on a larger cardboard scratcher. I bought a bunch of these to stuff adoption bags for the local shelter to encourage new kitty adopters to enable natural scratching behavior on a "safe" surface (i.e. not the couch!).
customer_reviews.author: The Chick & The Cook

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description but otherwise good cat scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! The description says set of 4 but you actually get only one! So it's very misleading. Nonetheless, the item itself is very good. My cats love it and it lasts a few weeks. When that's done, you can turn out over to the other side. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Eric F

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but my cats don't use it. Too small I think.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality scratcher at a very fair price, but my medium-large-size cats don't use it at all. They sniff it, but I've never seen them scratch it. I think they prefer something larger. This would be a good choice for a kitten or a small cat though.
customer_reviews.author: Lisak

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money, wish it was longer though
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money, but I’d give it full stars if it was a little longer. If you actually hang it on a door knob it’s so short that our cat won’t even use it, and doesn’t have full range to scratch. We just leave it on the floor and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Just thought it was longer in length
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these at PetSmart and my cat loved it. This one is much shorter than the PetSmart one, but that was my fault for not measuring the other one. I just figured, because it was the same price as the one at PetSmart it would be the same length, but I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: Paula P

customer_reviews.title: Falls Easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my cat likes to scratch at the walls. He also really likes the cardboard scratcher that sit on the floor, so I thought this hanging one would be perfect. The problem is that it falls off the doorknob super easily when my cat uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is in expensive, it’s still not worth it. It is unrealistic that a cat (or at least mine) would actually use this. The catnip has no effect on attracting my cat to the scratcher. My cat could care less and I think the fact it hangs and moves freely from a door nov doesn’t help. You’d be better off to pay a little more and get a real scratching post.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a set of 4
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I didn't read the review that told me it wasn't a set of 4, only one came.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gillen

customer_reviews.title: Not Every Cat May Use This
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this scratcher with the expectation that my male tabby cat would use it instead of my couch or other furniture. Much to my dismay, he tried it once and never used it again. I put catnip on it to entice him, but found out my cat isn't attracted to catnip. Not all cats are. I rated this product a 3 because it was made well, but was not helpful in my cat household. Perhaps other cats may make good use of it.
customer_reviews.author: Magra

customer_reviews.title: Recommend it along with a good nail clipping regimen
customer_reviews.text: My cats had been tearing up my couches and the box spring on my daughter bed. We try to keep the cats nails clipped regularly but they grow back pretty fast. So we tried this thing to see if they would use it instead of my furniture. Well it took a couple of days but then we noticed that they discovered it and were using it. So I recommend it along with a good nail clipping regimen. When the cats nails get really pointy, they have the natural urge to scratch them down.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This is the best!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! My cat loves to be able to stretch up and scratch and stretch her paws and back... This product has saved my door trim and furniture from further scratching! All she wanted this whole time was to be able to stretch herself up! She enjoys the cardboard product as well... I have to replace this product about once every 3-6 months because she scratches it all the way down... But it's worth it to save my furniture and home as well as providing some much needed kitty enrichment for her...
customer_reviews.author: SapphireSky

customer_reviews.title: Scratch Away Kitties!
customer_reviews.text: OK - this may sound crazy, but my son was moving to another state and has 3 cats. When we finally got them to their new home we set up new toys for them to play with. The old toys were there too, so don't worry. Just wanted to make their experience in the new place as fun as it could be. My son attached this to his tiled kitchen wall - so far the Command Mega Hook is holding up. We shall see - anyway this is a great value and product.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Hatzfeld

customer_reviews.title: We use this for our rescued cats
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our rescued cats that are housed in Petco cubicle cages. All of the rescued cats use it. The only downside is it leaves a little mess, but that's to be expected. P.S. For those that aren't aware: please try to shop at smile.amazon.com, your purchases will support [Charity of your choice]. i don't work for Amazon, i just think this is a great service from Amazon that some ppl might not be aware of. For example, my charity is for the medical care for animals in Romania.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot

customer_reviews.title: It is not going to last forever - but the idea is great. Right away
customer_reviews.text: So, this is cardboard. It is not going to last forever - but the idea is great. Right away, I re-enforced the pop up part with packaging tape, and it has helped it take an amazing amount of scratching buy my 17 pound cat. He is a huge cat (nose to butt, 2 feet, plus a foot of tail) and needs the ability to stretch while scratching. I hung this on my deck door, and now he leaves my kitchen chair backs alone! Priceless. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jody L. Jordet

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly saves my rugs & furniture!
customer_reviews.text: Best couple of dollars I've spent in a long time. My Lulu can't get enough of this thing, and she hasn't scratched another single item in the house since I got it. It sits right next to a rug that she used to LOVE to sharpen her claws on (which annoyed me constantly) and she hasn't touched the rug since. I will always keep a couple of these around!
customer_reviews.author: P. Waydo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Maybe another cat would like them, but neither of mine do. My boy loves cardboard for scratching, but wants nothing to do with this. His sister seems equally non plussed. Even with catnip she mostly ignored it.
customer_reviews.author: willisotaTop Contributor: Firefly (TV Show)

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried an array of cat scratching apparatuses...rope, carpet, poles....my cat refused to use any of them. I think she just didn't understand what she was supposed to do with them. At first, when I hung this one on the door, she paid no attention to it. I think it hangs a little too high for cats to get to. I moved it to the floor, under one of our coffee tables, and I didn't even have to coax her to try it. She was on it right away. Success! Anytime she starts scratching anything she isn't supposed to, I throw her on this scratcher. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: JSH

customer_reviews.title: Effective Product
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a new cat with claws. My other cat does not have them. The new cat immediately starting using this scratching pole. I didn't hang it on the door because it seems a little shoddy to hold up if a cat's scratching it but I put the door part under a table leg so the new cat can use it horizontally. I sprinkled the catnip that came with it and both cats started using it, even the declawed one. One cat liked to sleep on it also. So for the price, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Great value and product!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great price for these scratchers. I got mine today and hung it on a door knob. They’re already using it! Thanks for the fast delivery and great product!
customer_reviews.author: Lesley L

customer_reviews.title: Best deal  for cats.
customer_reviews.text: This is the silliest thing I have bought for the cats. They love it. I need to buy another one or two. I wish I had had it when the big orange cats were kittens and scratching my couch. I sprinkled only a little of the cat nip in it, which got them curious. All 4 cats love this scratch pad. Cheddar tried to hide it. He likes to hide his favorite toys. I have had it a while and vacuum the shreds every couple of days. It is still going strong as a cat attraction.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: My cat won't use it
customer_reviews.text: My cat is not interested in the scratchpad. Even after I put a liberal amount of the catnip on it. I cannot get her to use it or to even be curious about it. I have tried to hang it on the door or put it on the floor. I have tried putting it in several places but to no avail. She does use her other scratching post so it seems that she just does not like this product.
customer_reviews.author: LoraLeighAddict

customer_reviews.title: it's still a good product & I love that you can hang it ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the smallest without reading how small it was. It's tiny! However, it's still a good product & I love that you can hang it on a doorknob. The smallest size is best for a kitten, but it doesn't stop our full grown cats from using it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I've never known a cat who did not love these kinds of things. They love to get their claws dug into the cardboard and pull off the outer shell of their claws. Heaven. I don't remember where I got my last batch but they were bigger in all dimensions. And not much more expensive. The problem with this is it is very thin and light so it won't stay put. The cats love to really PULL and that means this thing goes along for the ride.
customer_reviews.author: Mike De Bruyn

customer_reviews.title: 1 for the price of 4
customer_reviews.text: The scratcher itself is great. My foster kitten loves it already. The listing is misleading because it is sold as a set of 4 but you only actually receive one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Graham

customer_reviews.title: cat scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Cats LOVE these and they get lots of use out of them. I only wish the outer cardboard square was a little more sturdy. I have to tape up the sides so the insert doesn't fall out. Also more catnip would be nice. The size and height are good, I put it in the corner of my living room. Will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: deborah d

customer_reviews.title: Not good for short cats??
customer_reviews.text: It's a standard, functional corrugated cardboard scratch pad. Serves it's purpose. Only con is that it hangs very high up on the door and my cat really doesn't know it's there. I put the catnip in it and she at least noticed it was there but only half-heartedly used it a few times. I put it on the floor, and now she occasionally uses it. She much prefers the.
customer_reviews.author: S. Meade

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT, however
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT, however, my cat doesn't fully grasp the hanging scratching post concept so he has yet to use it. I will keep it around in case he ever figures it out. It seems sturdy and it's very cute. Just don't put it on a doorknob for a door that you open constantly. I put it on the spare bathroom but I go in there at least once a day. It gets in the way a little when you go to close the door.
customer_reviews.author: April Wright

customer_reviews.title: Cute. Dunno if the cat uses it but it’s cute.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t seen the cat use it when I’m around. But it doesn’t look bad hanging on a door knob so it will stay there whether she uses it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Ewok

customer_reviews.title: Got several, lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, so bought four of these and placed them at various spots through the house where there is furniture and one more in the hall. The cats use all of them regularly and rarely need to be reminded not to scratch furniture.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really use it on door, yet
customer_reviews.text: The seller was fine, but the product wobbles too much for her to scratch and get a good stretch (which is why I wanted one on the door). I am planning on maybe using velcro or something to get it firmly on there, I'll figure it out. Right now it isn't being used unless I hold it on the door. She approves of the catnip, but it doesn't go in the scratcher easily. It's more of just sitting on top.
customer_reviews.author: Lilia

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 reversible scratcher not set of 4
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set to put around furniture to keep my cat from tearing up my new furniture, but there is only one.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Crout

customer_reviews.title: Our cat has ignored EVERY single sisal wrapped scratching post ...
customer_reviews.text: Our cat has ignored EVERY single sisal wrapped scratching post we purchased, and he ignored the cardboard kind that sat on the floor. But this one hanging from the doorknob of our coat closet he can't get enough of. I'm so relieved we finally found a scratching pad he uses!
customer_reviews.author: Brontoswife

customer_reviews.title: YES, something that works.
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old kitten uses this scratcher every time she wakes up from a nap. She had previously used the back of my computer chair. I can't believe this worked. Would definitely recommend. I have it at an incline near my chair. As a side note, we have many other cat scratchers throughout the house, this is the only one she uses several times a day.
customer_reviews.author: nelle684

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these. He won't use them hanging on the door, but he loves them when I laid them on the floor. They are placed throughout the house. If you have a cat that likes to scratch, this will keep his Paw's somewhere beside your furniture. The only negative is the little pieces of cardboard, but that's not hard to keep clean. A really good product, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: joanna r

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The cat doesn't use it at all because of the size. I should have realized it since the price is so low.
customer_reviews.author: Yang

customer_reviews.title: so good! Got two of these to hang off doorknobs
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Got two of these to hang off doorknobs. Kitten loves them (didn't sprinkle catnip packet yet since only a kitten). Keeps her occupied and away from other stuff that she shouldn't be scratching. Also, it's up off the floor and non-intrusive compared to some of the other huge contraptions they make for cats. Great price too - they were Amazon Add-Ons. I love those!
customer_reviews.author: Rose B.

customer_reviews.title: SmartyKat Scratch Up Cat Scratcher
customer_reviews.text: My adopted outdoor cat..now indoor cat..loves these scratchers, especially if I sprinkle a little of the catnip that comes with each one on the scratcher. Pieces of the cardboard will get on the floor, but so what. It makes Mr. Lucky happy. Oh, before I forget. I don't hang these things on a door. I take the scratcher out of the holder and lay them on the floor so he can grab and hold onto them, and roll around on the floor with them. CUTE!
customer_reviews.author: gail

customer_reviews.title: My cats went wild and they love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats and they routinely use my new couch for scratching purpose, readily ignoring the scratch post I placed next to the couch. It irks me a lot. So I bought this one and sprinkled catnip on the surface. My cats went wild and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A PACK OF FOUR.
customer_reviews.text: Item description clearly states "Set of 4," but only one item was received. Absolutely false advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W.

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 For the Price! Still Good Value!!
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as a set of 4 but only received one. Still an okay product for the price of around $4. Quite small and too short for my taste to hang on a standard door knob. I placed this near my cat's new tower as an extra scratching surface.
customer_reviews.author: Shanea Miles

customer_reviews.title: solid value in a narrow scratcher
customer_reviews.text: REALLY great value in a small scratcher -- yes, it's narrow, but it satisfies the need if you need a lot of scratchers in a lot of places. We mostly just put them on the ground. All over the place. Because my cat is a jerk and destroys carpets.
customer_reviews.author: JTH

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat prefers cardboard so this is great for him. We have one on the back door that he scratches to let us know he wants to go out into the breezeway. It can make a bit of a mess if you don't replace them often enough, but they are inexpensive and recyclable, so not a problem to do every month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Corkig

customer_reviews.title: It's only 1 item
customer_reviews.text: I was under the assumption that there were going to be 4 items not only just 1, its advertising was misleading only when u look at how many units does it say 1 unit when it says on top set of 4.
customer_reviews.author: zac

customer_reviews.title: I got this for a foster kitten and she loved it. I left it laying on the floor ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a foster kitten and she loved it. I left it laying on the floor for her but it does have a hanger attached so you can hang it from a doorknob. I looked at scratching posts at the local pet supply stores and they were all crazy expensive. Was glad to find this one.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy70

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend's cat destroys door frames. That's his current scratching post. With this hanging on the door knob right next to where he normally scratches he seems to go for this first instead (which is awesome) we haven't even added the catnip to it yet, we only plan on doing that if he stops playing with this and goes back to the door frames. I'll probably end up purchasing more of these for the rest of the doors in the house.
customer_reviews.author: gsgwdisnerd

customer_reviews.title: wrong item sent / incorrect listing
customer_reviews.text: beware, I only recieved 1 scratcher when the listing says pack of 4. extremely irritating, & too much of a pain to return it to get my refund. I should just be able to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: a. b.

customer_reviews.title: but nevertheless - he does really like it.
customer_reviews.text: So my cat is probably just a weirdo, but I have not seen him scratch this once - only lick it. From the moment I unwrapped it he only wants to lick it. Even before I put catnip on it. It's really strange, and not what I intended when I purchased it, but nevertheless - he does really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, dense cardboard
customer_reviews.text: Took in 34 terrified cats from a hoarder situation and tie wrapped these in the crates. Their nails were extremely long and these held up to the task. Sturdier than most I have ever bought. They are a smaller size than I would buy normally, but needed them to fit in the crates.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bors

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good quality scratcher. Unfortunately, my cat likes the flat scratchers more so hanging it up is a waste for my cat lol but the scratcher itself is good and when hung up, doesn't get in the way. We'll just leave it hanging in case she changes her mind lol doubtful, but we can still lay it flat so we get some use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: The Milkdudd

customer_reviews.title: I love that this scratcher has a pop-up handle to hang ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that this scratcher has a pop-up handle to hang it on a door knob. It's so convenient. My cat actually uses this one so much that I will need to buy a new one soon. With other similar scratchers, he didn't enjoy using them as much because they just sat on the floor and when he scratched them, they would move. This one stays put so he can scratch away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my kitchen door
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. I do use some command strips to keep it in place. Of course it took almost a week for her to get use to it but now she scratch it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Candycrushislife.exe

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: My cat has not touched my furniture since I bought several of these and placed them around the house. You have to clean up the cardboard flakes every once in a while, but it's so worth it. Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description
customer_reviews.text: The listing very clearly states "pack of 4" and it is really a pack of one. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: D. Achtenberg

customer_reviews.title: Put in the corners of the couch to save the upholstery.
customer_reviews.text: we nailed these onto the back of our couch, where the cat had decided to set up nail scratching shop. She now goes straight for these and ignores the couch upholstery. Obviously this isn't a fancy couch, but we wanted to keep her from shredding it. And these are far more cost effective than some of the other products I found.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Weigel

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great deal and easy to place against wall my kitten to have a designated place for scratching
customer_reviews.author: Lina Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Don’t believe the measurements, They are totally bogus
customer_reviews.text: 20 1/4” bull, more like 12x4x1 so upset that the description is so bogus
customer_reviews.author: Kepela

customer_reviews.title: Tears them apart pretty quick, but they're cheap and she used them ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat is obsessed. Tears them apart pretty quick , but they're cheap and she used them instead of my furniture. Note: I've given her plenty of trees. She doesn't like them. She goes nuts for this Though, without catnip
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Recommend buying!
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves this scratch board! He used it immediately after opening it. He used it hanging on the door and on the floor!
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: My cat would rather scratch my furniture
customer_reviews.text: It was a fine product, my cat just wasn’t interested.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah C.

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love these
customer_reviews.text: Our cats scratch everything (not cool) except actual scratch pads. We have tried nicer looking scratch posts and they just don't care. We have one of these in their main hang out areas and they are obsessed with them. They leave little shreds of stuff all over but I am fine vacuuming up shreds of cardboard instead of patching up holes in our door posts.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: scratcher is great texture
customer_reviews.text: my cat really reacted to this scratcher and has only since scratched on this more. she prefers it to her other scratchers and likes to rest over it even though it is tiny. i will be looking to replace this/get a bigger versionwhen possible.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: The only scratcher my cat will touch
customer_reviews.text: My cat REFUSES to use any other scratcher. I've bought her big, fancy ones, cone shaped rope ones, cardboard house shaped ones, the kind attached to cat trees, she hated them. Wouldn't go near it. I don't know what it is, but she LOVES this thing. Happy cat, and no more scratching my rug. I'm on my 5th or 6th and will continue to buy. Bonus, they're super cheap!
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Informarion
customer_reviews.text: Overall 2 star rating because of the misleading post. I selected the set of 4 thinking I would receive 4 scratchers and only received 1. However, it says set of 4 in multiple locations. Very frustrating and misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Spann

customer_reviews.title: Not a set of 4!
customer_reviews.text: It's fine for $4 but it says it's a set of 4 when it's only 1. Not advertised correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a set of 4
customer_reviews.text: You only get 1. I would have bought something else for this price, and it's not worth returning.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these. He goes through them quickly so I order a few at a time. He loves to scratch on them and gets excited when I open a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Amie

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: Very small... The smallest scratch board I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Jie Zhang

customer_reviews.title: It's fine for what it is but it lost a star ...
customer_reviews.text: It's fine for what it is but it lost a star because you can't turn over the cardboard piece and reuse the other side as I am able to do with another brand for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Krepta_64

customer_reviews.title: The good news : It works !
customer_reviews.text: But get used to picking up shredded cardboard ! My large 11-yr old male tears it up, like every other scratcher I've tried. I give it four months. One 9-yr old female prefers to scratch leather, but loves to lay on the catnipped corrugated cardboard. Her skittish sister--also 9--gives it no attention. The SmartyKat ScratchUp is a well-conceived product, inexpensive and eminently scratchable.
customer_reviews.author: David Rowe

customer_reviews.title: nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Received two and the cats used them at once. Good for the
customer_reviews.author: model T

customer_reviews.title: Every cat deserves at least one
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing and necessary tools for any cat. They are a very good price on here too. I highly recommend spoiling your cat (and yourself from furniture scratching) and buying a couple of these. My cat always has two and I replace them as needed. You can flip them over and use the other side once one is worn down, and if your cat doesn't like it hanging up try placing it on the ground. My cat likes to lay on hers.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Milos happiness.
customer_reviews.text: Milo loves this scratcher he uses it all the time instead of my furniture. I put a little cap nip in it and he goes to town. Probably why my arms and legs look the way they do. Great product, good pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Neaja

customer_reviews.title: Favorite cat toy
customer_reviews.text: It says that it is a pack of 4 so I was expecting 4 of them but only got 1. My cat likes these and loved to scratch them up
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Cat like sthem. Annoying as hell if you leave then ...
customer_reviews.text: Comes with catnip. Cat like sthem. Annoying as hell if you leave then on door handles as the cat bangs it off the door when using it. I put them on the floor. He loses interest as soon as the catnip is gone, though.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof4

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 of these, although I don't hang ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, although I don't hang them on doors, they are just on the floor. My 4 year old Russian Blue likes to just lay on them.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory And Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Nice hanging or on the floor - catnip included!
customer_reviews.text: The catnip really attracts my cat to this scratch board and it does the job. I think it will be pretty ripped up once he uses it for a while, but for the price, I would definitely purchase another. Plus it's nice to have the option of hanging it on the door handle or lying it on the ground. Either way, it attracts my cat to scratch with the smell of the catnip (included).
customer_reviews.author: BM99

customer_reviews.title: Our kitty loves these things! We put them all ...
customer_reviews.text: Our kitty loves these things! We put them all around the house and she mostly leaves other scratching temptations alone. She's 14 lbs and prefers the skinny ones, so she can perch on top of them while her fat spills over the sides. It's hilarious.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Happy Cat
customer_reviews.text: Other than furniture, this is the only thing my cat will scratch! He doesn't like fancy cat trees or any other more expensive clawing toys. I now have one on three different door knobs. Simple, inexpensive, and better for the environment since it's easily recycleable cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Handcock

customer_reviews.title: way too small
customer_reviews.text: way too small to hang from my doorknob (unless you're a Hobbit), cat wouldn't be able to reach it unless she was the size of a dog, and then I wouldn't need it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Too high and too small for door scratcher
customer_reviews.text: It's unfortunately too high to hang on a door for cats. But it works as just a regular old scratcher. If you want one for the door look elsewhere. It's also very tiny.
customer_reviews.author: JLS

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these to place around the house. So far only one of my two cats has used them but for the price they are nice to have so hopefully they don't scratch the carpet and furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

product_meta.title: SmartyKat Made in the USA Corrugate Cat Scratchers with Catnip Infused Technology
product_meta.description: Style:Scratch Up Set of 4This scratch up corrugate hanging cat scratcher offers both in one compact scratcher. use it as a hanging scratcher over almost any door knob or as a traditional floor scratcher. paw-pleasing corrugated scratcher. it can be use on floor or hanging from a door. includes smarty kat certified organic catnip. measures 20-1/4-Inch length by 5-1/3-Inch width by 7-Inch height.
feature_bullets: Smarty Kat scratch up provides an outlet for scratching, the Instinct to scratch is hard-wired into cats.
Corrugate scratchers have a texture which more closely mimics that of tree bark
Patent pending catnip infused technology allows your cat to release mess free catnip scent With every scratch
Hang-able from any door or place on the floor
Eco advantage-our corrugate is made from recycled paper pulp
100% satisfaction. If a customer is dissatisfied with a Smarty Kat product for any reason, we will replace or refund it

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
